desc_mixed_retrieval: Executes three retrieval modes simultaneously and uses RRF algorithm to rank results, selecting the most relevant results for user queries. Mixed retrieval balances semantic similarity and logical relevance, enhancing retrieval accuracy and result credibility through complementary advantages
desc_vector_retrieval: Converts user queries into vectors and matches similarity with knowledge base segments, returning highly similar results. Vector retrieval excels at semantic similarity matching and large-scale unstructured data processing, but lacks interpretability and precise relationship verification
desc_graph_retrieval: Retrieves knowledge related to user queries through relationship inference. Knowledge graph retrieval excels at precise entity relationship reasoning and logical verification, but has weaker support for unstructured text and semantic ambiguity queries
desc_full_text_retrieval: Matches vocabulary in documents through tokenization and returns text segments containing these words
tooltip_top_k: Maximum number of segments to recall from the knowledge base, minimum 1, maximum 10. More recalled segments consume more tokens.
tooltip_similarity_threshold: Only recalls text segments with similarity greater than the threshold. Range: 0~1. Higher threshold yields more accurate answers, recommended not to exceed 0.9
tooltip_metadata_filter: Metadata filtering uses metadata attributes (e.g., groups, knowledge creation time) to refine and control the retrieval process within the system. Only knowledge meeting requirements will be recalled.
tooltip_recall_neighbor_desc_1: When relevant segments are retrieved from the knowledge base, associated context will be concatenated based on configuration and returned to the LLM as final content.
tooltip_recall_neighbor_desc_2: After enabling, avoid setting segment overlap length during segmentation, as it may affect the final result.
tooltip_recall_neighbor_desc_3: No processing will be applied to knowledge bases with parent-child segment types, or when segment word count exceeds 3000 characters.
